intro: Corydalis jonesii var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with reddish hues. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
